Reported Version: v0.1.3.2 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 11 Home 64-bit (10.0, Build 22621) | CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 3750H with Radeon Vega Mobile Gfx | GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTF 1650 GDDR5 @ 4BG (128 bits) | RAM: 12.81 GB

 

This bug report is more so 2 bugs in 1 that are connected.

Events that led to the bug:

1. I was controlling a vessel in low Duna orbit

2. From there I switched to map view and attempted to control a vessel landed at Kerbin 

1st bug: The blue icon remaining on the Duna vessel indicated that I did not switch control, despite doing so.

3. I switched back to vessel view

2nd bug: I noticed what appeared to be a full-scale rendition of the Kerbin landscape clipping through Duna right beside my craft. It appeared stationary relative to my craft, and I believe this ghost Kerbin may have been the area where the game failed to switch control to the craft on Kerbin, but the ghost planet's lighting and detail are off, so I can't be certain. See the screenshot for reference.

4. After zooming out a lot and rotating the camera, roughly half a minute after the ghost planet appeared, it vanished and that was it. I was able to switch to the Kerbin vessel and nothing else was weird.

I don't know any definite cause for the bug, as I've done the steps that led to the bug many times without it occurring, but I did happen to change my focus a lot before the incident. It is also important to note that another Duna vessel was in close proximity (It says 578m in one of the screenshots) to the vessel I tried to switch control from.
